body.p: Also Spelled Flournoy. Born in Powhatan County, Virginia. Graduated from Cumberland College, Princeton, Kentucky in 1840. Became a licensed lawyer in 1841. 1841 moved to Paducah, Kentucky. Editor of the West Kentuckian in Paducah from 1844 to 1849. Became President of Commercial Bank of Kentucky at Paducah, Kentucky in 1853. Was President of the Paducah Gaslight Company. Established the Paducah and Nashville Telegraph Company to form a telegraph line from Paducah, Kentucky to Nashville, Tennessee with J. W. Jones in 1856. Became president of the New Orleans and Ohio River Railroad Company in 1865. Died in Spokane County, Washington.
